Player History
Signed as a free agent by Seattle on 4/1/1985 to a 1-year deal worth $412,000 per year...
Earned first career win on 5/28/1986...
Injured on 4/20/1987 with a Tight Shoulder, out for 1-2 weeks...
2/2/1988: Gets a new one-year contract worth $920,000 through salary arbitration...
2/2/1989: Gets a new one-year contract worth $2,565,714 through salary arbitration...
Injured on 7/27/1989 with a Inflamed Back Muscle, out for one week...
Injured on 10/28/1989 with a Bone Chips Shoulder, out for 5 weeks...
2/2/1990: Gets a new one-year contract worth $2,577,143 through salary arbitration...
Was selected to the 1990 Allstar game...
Traded from Seattle to Chicago on 7/27/1990 (Going to CHC: P Mike Schooler. Going to SEA: P Paul Miller, P Tim Wakefield, P Paul Assenmacher, P Antonio Alfonseca)...
10/23/1990: Signed a contract extension with Chicago, $6,500,000 per year, for 4 years.
